author: Livemint
title: Check Pics: Leh skies light up with spectacular aurora as geomagnetic storm hits Earth
text: The skies above Leh were illuminated by a breathtaking aurora display on Thursday (October 10) when a severe geomagnetic storm hit Earth. The rare occurrence was captured at India‚Äôs highest observatory in Hanle.The event was initiated by a potent coronal mass ejection (CME) from the Sun that arrived at Earth on Friday. The CME stemmed from an X1.8-class solar flare on October 9 and hurtled through space at speeds surpassing 1.5 million miles per hour.The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) has classified the geomagnetic storm as G4, signaling severe conditions that can potentially disrupt power grids and satellite operations.Such storms can make auroras visible much farther south than usual, with sightings reported as far south as Alabama and Northern California in the United States.Rare auroras in LadakhIn Leh, the auroras‚Äô vibrant colours created a breathtaking spectacle against the backdrop of the night sky.The geomagnetic storm is a result of the current period of increased solar activity, with the Sun nearing its solar maximum, which is anticipated to reach its peak in 2025.This cycle has resulted in a rise in solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which cause auroras when charged particles interact with Earth‚Äôs magnetic field.The auroras seen in Leh were the direct consequence of these interactions, displaying dazzling reds that enthralled spectators.While the visual spectacle was breathtaking, scientists cautioned against possible disruptions due to the storm.High-frequency radio communications are already experiencing interference, and there is concern about the potential impact on satellite navigation systems. Power companies and aviation authorities have been advised to monitor conditions closely to mitigate any negative impacts.Residents and tourists alike were captivated by the celestial light display, while experts highlighted the significance of comprehending the effects of space weather on technology and infrastructure. This geomagnetic phenomenon demonstrates the dynamic nature of our Sun and its impact on life on Earth.

author: Kelli Saam
title: Viewers share photos of Northern Lights from Butte Co. and surrounding areas | News | actionnewsnow.com
text:
By: Kelli Saam Kelli Saam Kelli Saam is an anchor for Action News Now and rejoined the team in 2021.
Author email Oct 11, 2024 Oct 11, 2024 Updated 7 hrs ago 0 Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save The Aurora Borealis is lighting up the sky across the United States, including Northern California.
CHICO, Calif. - The Aurora Borealis is lighting up the sky across the United States including Northern California.
Photo from Lynn Furr in Oroville
By: Kelli Saam Butte County viewers sent photos to Action News Now of the Northern Lights seen Thursday evening. Lynn Furr reported seeing the lights from her property in Oroville. Another viewer saw the lights from Upper Bidwell Park in Chico.
Alert California cameras captured images of the Northern Lights dancing across the sky Thursday night in Modoc, Lassen, and Trinity Counties.
Northern Lights seen Thursday, Oct 10 from Oroville
By: Kelli Saam A powerful solar flair is causing these beautiful colors to reach us. The storm is expected to last through Friday.
If you have photos of the northern lights email them to 4news@actionnewsnow.com .

author: VNExplorer
title: Parkerville bushfires WA: Devastated family 'literally have nothing' after ferocious bushfire ripped through their home just days before Christmas
text:
Family lost their home to bushfireOwner watched house burn on TV from work READ MORE: Brisbane family loses to house fire days out from Christmas
The mother of a family who lost everything in a bushfire said she saw her family home burning to the ground on the TV at her work.
Julie Moody, her husband Craig and their children were set to host Christmas this year, a plan that went out the window when their Parkerville, east Perth, home was destroyed on Thursday.
A catastrophic bushfire in the area ‚Äì of the five emergency-level fires that threatened Western Australians over Wednesday and Thursday ‚Äì has reduced at least two homes to ashes.
While the blaze was burning through the suburb on Thursday, Mrs Moody had checked her security cameras to see how her family‚Äôs property was holding up.
She was shocked to see the fire was already at their pool and inching closer towards their three-storey home.
A family lost their Parkerville home (above) on Wednesday to the Perth Hills bushfires, just days before Christmas
Mother Julie Moody (above) said her husband just managed to rescue their family dogs from the burning home after she saw the fire creeping up on their CCTV
Mrs Moody quickly called her husband from her work and told him the house was in danger.
‚ÄòI rang my husband and told him to race home and he managed to get through the roadblocks to get the dogs out,‚Äô Mrs Moody told The West on Friday.
‚ÄòHe had to go through the barriers and a neighbour‚Äôs property because no one would let him in but if he didn‚Äôt do that the dogs would be gone.
‚ÄòThe verandah and home was already burning when he was there. He said it was very hot but he had to go to get the dogs out.‚Äô
Mrs Moody‚Äôs worst fears were confirmed a short time later when her colleagues showed her news footage of her home burning down.
While the family is grateful no-one was injured and their dogs made it out safe, they‚Äôve been left with nothing but the clothes on their backs.
Ms Moody said she watched news footage of her house (above) burning down from TV at work
‚ÄòIt‚Äôs devastating. It‚Äôs heartbreaking. The enormity of it is just unbelievable,‚Äô Mrs Moody said.
The family lost their home, shed, and several cars in the inferno ‚Äì including the rally car driven by their son, Sam.
Family friend, Kelly Thomas, has started a GoFundMe to help the family financially recover.
‚ÄòCraig, Julie and kids are kind, caring, hardworking humans who would do anything to help anyone in need,‚Äô the post reads.
‚ÄòSome would know them from rallying. Their youngest, Sam, is an aspiring rally driver who has just lost his race car and all his spares!
‚ÄòLet‚Äôs help the Moody‚Äôs get back on their feet for what will be a very tough Christmas and few months/years ahead.‚Äô
The family lost their home, shed, and several cars in the inferno ‚Äì including the rally car driven by their son, Sam
The fundraiser has collected 63 donations worth $7,960 within its first 12 hours.
The cause of the devastating Perth Hills fire has been pinpointed to a tree that fell on a power-line during strong winds at about 9.30am on Thursday.
Hot, dry winds in the regions fed the flames and it moved too quickly for firefighters to contain.

author: David Veenstra
title: Arizona forces six turnovers in Alamo Bowl victory over Oklahoma
text: Arizona defense forces six turnovers in Alamo Bowl victory over Oklahoma Dec 28, 2023, 10:58 PM | Updated: 11:15 pm (Photo by Ronald Cortes/Getty Images) In a game of momentum swings, Arizona‚Äôs defense came up big to lead the Wildcats to a 38-24 Alamo Bowl victory over Oklahoma. Arizona‚Äôs defense produced six turnovers on the night, highlighted by junior Gunner Maldonado‚Äôs two fumble recoveries and an interception. The Wildcats scored 28 points off turnovers to cement Arizona‚Äôs first bowl win since 2015. The Wildcats ended the season on a seven-game winning streak, their longest winning streak since 1998. It is also the first time since 2014 Arizona has won 10 games. Maldonado‚Äôs 87-yard fumble recovery, the first defensive touchdown of the season for the Wildcats, couldn‚Äôt have come at a better time for Arizona, as it snapped a streak in which the Sooners scored 24 unanswered points. Gunner Maldonado with an 87-yard pick-six. The TD and subsequent two-point conversion bring Arizona to within 3 of Oklahoma in the Alamo Bowl. The Wildcats needed a big play from the defense. That‚Äôs exactly what they got. [pic.twitter.com/wlwWBaLQSg] ‚Äî The Comeback (@thecomeback) [December 29, 2023] After going up 13-0 in the second quarter, Arizona‚Äôs offense tossed an interception and punted five times before finally ending the offensive drought by scoring a field goal to level the game at 24. After three quarters, the Wildcats were just 4-for-12 on third down, but midway through the fourth quarter, Noah Fifita had a couple massive third-down conversions. A key 16-yard completion to Tetairoa McMillan on third down came three plays before a 57-yard touchdown pass to Jacob Cowing on third down to put the Wildcats up 31-24. JACOB COWING 57 YARD HOUSE CALLüè° ‚Äî PFF College (@PFF_College) [December 29, 2023] It was Cowing‚Äôs second touchdown of the night. With his first quarter touchdown, Cowing set the Arizona single season receiving touchdown record with 12. The senior from Maricopa also moved into ninth on the FBS career receiving list, passing former Wyoming receiver Ryan Yarborough. Arizona then forced another turnover. Oklahoma QB Jackson Arnold was strip-sacked by Isaiah Ward and Jacob Kongaika recovered the fumble. After, a DJ Williams 19-yard touchdown run put Arizona up 38-24 to seal the victory. . [@isaiahward51]WITH A FORCED FUMBLE RECOVERED BY OUR GUY [@KongaikaRich]üî•üî•üî• üì∫:ESPN [pic.twitter.com/FSU0Hmoy0N] ‚Äî Arizona Football (@ArizonaFBall) [December 29, 2023] DJ. WILLIAMS. TD. [@djwilliams2366]üíØ Wildcats increase the lead, 38 -24 with 3 min left in the 4th Qtr.üòº üì∫: ESPN [pic.twitter.com/60klDvyAby] ‚Äî Arizona Football (@ArizonaFBall) [December 29, 2023]
